intro: Linum hispanicum, commonly known as Spanish flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 1 meter tall, characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is known for its fibrous蒴果, which contains small, oval seeds.
